sailpoint.api
Class EntitlementCorrelator

java.lang.Object
  sailpoint.api.EntitlementCorrelator

public class EntitlementCorrelator
extends java.lang.Object

The EntitlementCorrelator inspects identities and calculates assigned and detected roles and entitlement exceptions based on the attributes on the links. The identity can be updated with the roles and exceptions that are found or the results can be retrieved from the EntitlementCorrelator using the various getters.

Entitlement correlation can be performed for "impact analysis" to show how modifications to the role model would change role assignments and detections. This is enabled by setting the candidate roles and enabling the useCandidates flag before analyzing an identity.

The assignment and detection process has these steps for each identity:

  1. Find all "top level" roles, those with no super roles
  2. For each top level role, do a depth first traversal
  3. For each traversed role evaluate the assignment selector or try to match the profiles.
  4. If the assignment selector or profiles matched, check that all super roles also match to account for multiple inheritance.
  5. If the role and its supers match mark the role as matched and descend, otherwise stop traversing this path.

This process is repeated for top-level assignable roles, top-level detectable roles, and then for roles that are required/permitted by the assigned role (if there are any noDetectionUnlessAssigned role types).

Field Detail

ARG_PROMOTE_SOFT_PERMITS

public static final java.lang.String ARG_PROMOTE_SOFT_PERMITS
Option that causes us to promote soft permits into hard permits. The assigner will be "system".

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ARG_DEMOTE_SOFT_PERMITS

public static final java.lang.String ARG_DEMOTE_SOFT_PERMITS
Option that causes us to demote hard permits with assigner "system" back to soft permits. Undoes what promoteSoftPermits does. The options cannot be used in combination, if both are on, demoteSoftPermits takes precedence.

See Also:

Constant Field Values

LINK_LOAD_CONFIG_KEY

public static final java.lang.String LINK_LOAD_CONFIG_KEY
System config key that defines how to load links for detection. This should contain a comma-separated list of the STRATEGY_* constants, and defaults to "cache, search".

See Also:

prepare

public void prepare()
             throws GeneralException
Initialize the EntitlementCorrelator by caching some necessary data. Users do not need to call this, it will be called automatically by the primary interface methods, but you may wish to call it early if you want to clean the Hibernate cache immediately afterward.

Throws:
GeneralException

setDoRoleAssignment

public void setDoRoleAssignment(boolean b)
This turns role assignment on and off.

setUseCandidates

public void setUseCandidates(boolean b)
This turns candidate awareness on and off. Used only by the Wonderer.

setCandidates

public void setCandidates(java.util.List<Bundle> roles)
Register a set of candidate roles to be used in correlation.

The role/profile definitions on these lists are preferred over than the ones currently in the repository. This allows for correlation using role versions that are not actually active for "what if" analysis. These are ignored if useCandidates is false.

setNoPersistentIdentity

public void setNoPersistentIdentity(boolean notPersistent)
Tell the EntitlementCorrelator whether the identities it is dealing with are fully persisted. When disabled, this turns off some optimizations around loading identity/link data via queries rather than iterating over the data model.

setPromoteSoftPermits

public void setPromoteSoftPermits(boolean b)
Set an option that causes the promotion of soft permits into hard permits. The assigner will be "system".

setDemoteSoftPermits

public void setDemoteSoftPermits(boolean b)
Set an option that causes the demotion of hard permits with assigner "system" back to soft permits. Undoes what promoteSoftPermits does. The options cannot be used in combination, if both are on, demoteSoftPermits takes precedence.

printStats

public void printStats()
Print statistics about the correlation model.

getCorrelationModel

public sailpoint.api.CorrelationModel getCorrelationModel()
Return the CorrelationModel being used by the correlation.

This is used by the Entitlizer so it can use the same CorrelationModel used during entitlement correlation when adorning data to the IdentityEntitlements.

saveResults

public void saveResults(TaskResult result)
Save accumulated results in a TaskResult. Used when this class is called from an identity refresh task.

getEntitlementExceptions

public java.util.List<EntitlementGroup> getEntitlementExceptions()
                                                          throws GeneralException
Return the entitlement exceptions, which are the entitlements on the identity that were not detected at least once by any roles. Should be called after EntitlementCorrelator.analyzeIdentity(Identity).

analyzeIdentity

public void analyzeIdentity(Identity identity)
                     throws GeneralException
Correlate entitlements for an Identity but do not modify it. This is used in most cases where entitlement analysis is needed but you might not be prepared to commit modifications to the Identity for performance or other reasons.

This function must be called prior to using any of the result methods like getRoleAssignments, getRoleDetections, getEntitltmentMappings, or getEntitlementExceptions.

Parameters:
identity - The Identity to be analyzed.
Throws:
GeneralException

analyzeIdentity

public void analyzeIdentity(Identity identity,
                            boolean strictIdentityComparison)
                     throws GeneralException
Correlate entitlements for an Identity but do not modify it.

You can improve performance when calling analyze multiple times for the same identity by setting strictIdentityComparison = false. This should only be done is cases where the Identity is not being modified between calls.

Parameters:
identity - The Identity to be analyzed.
strictIdentityComparison - If True, resuse a previous analysis if identity == lastIdentity. If false compare using identity.equals(lastIdentity).
Throws:
GeneralException

saveAnalysis

public void saveAnalysis(Identity identity)
                  throws GeneralException
Store the results of a prior analysis in the identity. This is public so callers of analyzeIdentity can decide whether they want to make the analysis permanent.

Throws:
GeneralException

analyzeContributingEntitlements

public void analyzeContributingEntitlements(Identity identity)
                                     throws GeneralException
Do contributing entitlement analysis for one identity. The results are saved in the assignmentStates and uncoveredState. Since this does not do unguided detection, unguidedState will not be set.

The results of this analysis may be inspected using the getContributingEntitlements methods.

Throws:
GeneralException

analyzeContributingEntitlements

public void analyzeContributingEntitlements(Identity identity,
                                            RoleAssignment assignment)
                                     throws GeneralException
Do contributing entitlement analysis for one assignment on an identity. This is an optimization for a few parts of the UI that do not need a full analysis.

Throws:
GeneralException

getContributingEntitlements

public java.util.List<EntitlementGroup> getContributingEntitlements(RoleAssignment assignment,
                                                                    Bundle detectedRole,
                                                                    boolean flattened)
                                                             throws GeneralException
Return the contributing entitlements for a detected role within the context of one assignment.

The analyzeContributingEntitlements method that does NOT take a RoleAssignemnt must have been called previously. Use this if you are in a situation where you need contributing entitlements for multiple detections, but you only want to pay the overhead of the analysis once.

Throws:
GeneralException

getContributingEntitlements

public java.util.List<EntitlementGroup> getContributingEntitlements(Identity identity,
                                                                    RoleAssignment assignment,
                                                                    Bundle detectedRole,
                                                                    boolean flattened)
                                                             throws GeneralException
First analyize contributing entitlements for the identity, then return the contributing entitlements for a detected role within the context of one assignment.

Use this in a situation where you will only be analyzing contributions for one role and do not need to reuse the analysis for a different role.

Throws:
GeneralException

setSourceRoles

@Deprecated
public void setSourceRoles(java.util.List<Bundle> roles)
Deprecated. This is not so necessary since things have been sped up with the cached CorrelationModel. The roles that are evaluated could be limited, but this is not so easy since a top-down evaluation is done and the roles passed to setSourceRoles() will be leaves (not likely top-level roles).

@Deprecated
public java.util.Map<Bundle,java.util.List<EntitlementGroup>> getEntitlementMappings(Identity identity)
                                                                              throws GeneralException
Deprecated. Use EntitlementCorrelator.analyzeIdentity(Identity) followed by EntitlementCorrelator.getEntitlementMappings(boolean).

Run a correlation on the Identity (do not save the results back on the identity) and retrieve a mapping of role to entitlements that grant the role.

Parameters:
identity - The Identity for which to retrieve the mappings.
Returns:
A mapping of role to entitlements that grant the role.
Throws:
GeneralException

getDetectedRoles

@Deprecated
public java.util.List<Bundle> getDetectedRoles()
                                        throws GeneralException
Deprecated. Use EntitlementCorrelator.getDistinctDetectedRoles(List) System code should no longer be using this since there can be more than one detection for a given role.

Return the distinct list of detected roles as freshly fetched objects or candidate roles.

Throws:
GeneralException

getAutoAssignedRoles

@Deprecated
public java.util.List<Bundle> getAutoAssignedRoles()
                                            throws GeneralException
Deprecated. Use EntitlementCorrelator.getDistinctAssignedRoles(List)

Return the newly calculated list of auto-assigned roles. This does not include manually assigned roles. The returned roles will be fetched and in the Hibernate session. The List is owned by the caller.

Throws:
GeneralException

getRoleEnititlementMapping

@Deprecated
public java.util.Map<sailpoint.api.CorrelationModel.CorrelationRole,java.util.List<EntitlementGroup>> getRoleEnititlementMapping(boolean flattened)
                                                                                                                          throws GeneralException
Deprecated. Use EntitlementCorrelator.getContributingEntitlements(Identity, RoleAssignment, Bundle, boolean)

Returns a map of CorrelationRole -> Entitlement group.

If flattened is true, only the most specific roles are returned with the entitlements used to match all roles in the hierarchy. If flattened is false, each matching role is returned with the matching entitlements for only that role.

Throws:
GeneralException

getEntitlementMappings

@Deprecated
public java.util.Map<Bundle,java.util.List<EntitlementGroup>> getEntitlementMappings()
                                                                              throws GeneralException
Deprecated. Use EntitlementCorrelator.getContributingEntitlements(Identity, RoleAssignment, Bundle, boolean)

Return the results of role detection as a mapping between a Bundle and a list of EntitlementGroups representing the entitlements that were used to match that role.

Throws:
GeneralException

getEntitlementMappings

@Deprecated
public java.util.Map<Bundle,java.util.List<EntitlementGroup>> getEntitlementMappings(boolean flattened)
                                                                              throws GeneralException
Deprecated. Use EntitlementCorrelator.getContributingEntitlements(Identity, RoleAssignment, Bundle, boolean)

Return a mapping between a role and the entitlements that grant the role. If flattened is true, only the most specific roles are returned with the entitlements used to match all roles in the hierarchy. If flattened is false, each matching role is returned with the matching entitlements for only that role.
